title: Bug: “Curso Vinculado” is not saved/loaded when editing a draft event
body: **Preconditions:** User authenticated as Organizer Event creation flow (multi-step wizard) available **Steps to Reproduce:** 1- Open Novo Evento → details step. 2- Click Alterar curso and select any course (e.g., “CST em Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas”). 3- Go to page events/mine 4- Click Editar Evento on the draft you just saved. 5- Navigate to page event/details **Expected Result:** The Curso Vinculado field shows the previously selected course (label retained). The selected course is included in the step’s state and final payload. **Actual Result:** The Curso Vinculado field appears empty after returning to the step and with alteration button enabled. Other fields on the page do keep their values. It's not possible to proceed to the next step

title: Bug: Event confirmation page displays raw JSON instead of formatted event details
body: **Preconditions:** An authorized email and an event has been created and user navigates to the "Confirmar Dados do Evento" page. **Steps to Reproduce: Create a new event with valid data (title, description, participants, etc.). Navigate to the confirmation page: .../event/confirm-data?eventId=. Observe the event details displayed. **Expected Result:** Event data should be displayed in a structured, readable format with clear labels (e.g., Title, Description, Participants, Date). JSON should be parsed and rendered into proper UI components (e.g., cards, lists, or tables). Optional fields should be hidden or displayed as “N/A” instead of showing empty values ("" or {}). **Actual Result:** Page shows raw JSON output directly (see screenshot). Data is not organized, making it hard for users to confirm event details. Empty or irrelevant fields (logo: {}, "trilhaDesc": "") are displayed. **Severity:** Severity: Medium (blocks usability — users cannot clearly review event details).

title: Bug: Auxiliary text field behavior incorrect when Yes/No field is selected
body: **Preconditions:** Have an authorized email **Steps to reproduce:** 1- Navigate to Event Register form 2- Navigate to Event Logistics step 3- In the fields "Trilha empreendedora" and/or "Projeto Extensão" select "Sim" 4- Leave the auxiliary text field empty. 5- Attempt to proceed to the next step. 6- Go back and change the selection to "Não". 7- Try typing text into the auxiliary text field. **Expected Result:** - If "Sim" is selected, the auxiliary text field should become mandatory, and the user cannot proceed without entering text. - If "Não" is selected, the auxiliary text field should be disabled (not editable). **Actual Result:** - User can select "Sim" and proceed without entering text in the auxiliary field - Auxiliary text field is still editable even when "No" is selected. **Severity:** Severity: High (validation bypass allows incomplete data submission).

title: Bug: Email field does not send the email when press Enter in 'organizer' page
body: **Preconditions:** Preconditions not required **Steps to reproduce:** 1- Open the 'organizer' page 2- Type in the text field 3- Press Enter **Expected Result:** Should send the email to authentication project and continue the flow **Actual Result:** Does nothing **Severity/Priority:** Severity: Medium (Does not block the user but breaks expected functionality) Priority: High (Affects User Experience)

title: feat: loading entre os steps do formulário
Theme: DARK MODE
body:
## 📄 Description

Add a dark mode feature to the React application, allowing users to switch between light and dark themes. The toggle should be a floating button anchored in the bottom-right corner of the viewport, following the design provided in Figma.

**Figma Design:**
[https://www.figma.com/design/A5jKxrxuTpR5rufFCMKUFN/UDF-Room-and-Events-management?node-id=0-1\&p=f\&t=T29iPOCbTRecYCid-0](https://www.figma.com/design/A5jKxrxuTpR5rufFCMKUFN/UDF-Room-and-Events-management?node-id=0-1&p=f&t=T29iPOCbTRecYCid-0)

---

## 🎯 User Acceptance Criteria

1. **Toggle Visibility & Placement**

   * [x] A floating theme-toggle button appears in the bottom-right corner of every page.
   * [x] The button’s appearance (icon, size, hover/focus states) matches the Figma specification.

2. **Theme Switching**

   * [x] Clicking the toggle switches between light and dark themes in real time.
   * [x] All existing UI components (backgrounds, text, cards, buttons, etc.) update their styles based on the selected theme.

3. **State Management**

   * [x] The theme state is managed via a `ThemeContext` implemented with React’s `useContext` hook.
   * [x] Components consume the current theme through `useContext(ThemeContext)` rather than prop-drilling.

4. **Persistence**

   * [x] The user’s theme preference is saved to `localStorage` and reapplied on page reload.
   * [x] If no preference exists, default to the user’s OS‐level color scheme (`prefers-color-scheme` media query).

5. **Accessibility**

   * [x] The toggle button includes an accessible `aria-label` that reflects the current action (e.g., “Switch to dark mode” or “Switch to light mode”).
   * [ ] Keyboard users can focus and activate the toggle (e.g., via Tab + Enter/Space).


## ✅ Task Checklist

* [x] Create `ThemeContext` and `ThemeProvider`.
* [x] Wrap the root of the app with `<ThemeProvider>`.
* [x] Implement `ThemeToggleButton` component and place it in the main layout.
* [x] Define light/dark theme variables and apply them globally.
* [x] Ensure components read theme via `useContext(ThemeContext)` and adapt styles.
* [x] Persist preference in `localStorage` and respect OS default on first load.
* [x] Add `aria-label` and keyboard support to the toggle.
* [x] Review against Figma design for visual consistency.

title: Bug_fix: Consistência do estado do curso
body: O valor do campo curso em EventDetails.js continua selecionado ao seguir para o próximo passo e voltar, mas quando segue para o passo anterior de `EventDetails.js` e volta, o valor do campo curso mantêm selecionado mas perde o estado do valor do campo

Refactor: Migrar react-script para react router framework
Split the Form Submit Between /events and /reservations
body:
## Description: Separate the workflow into two partes, first save the event, second request room and datetime (request reservation).
### Key Tasks:
- Adjust form component to post/update data into these two data structures (event and reservations).
### Acceptance Criteria:
- Data is properly routed to the correct endpoint.
- No confusion between event-specific and reservation-specific data.
